etymologies: early 20th century: from German Rotogravur, part of the name of a printing company

definitions: a printing system using a rotary press with intaglio cylinders, typically running at high speed and used for long print runs of magazines and stamps

examples.text: we would love to find a sheet suitable for rotogravure that is not exorbitantly priced

shortDefinitions: printing system using rotary press with intaglio cylinders

definitions: a sheet or magazine printed by rotogravure, especially the color magazine of a Sunday newspaper

examples.text: you could go to the races in it and get your picture in the rotogravure
the rotogravure section of the Sunday World

shortDefinitions: sheet or magazine printed with rotogravure system
